tool.help:
**What it does**
Compute small RNA (piRNA, siRNA, ...) signatures.
This tool computes (i) the number of pairs by overlap classes (in nt) and associated the z-scores, and (ii) the ping-pong signal (`Brennecke et al, 2009`_) and associated z-scores. Options set the min and max size of both the query small rna class and the target small rna class, the range over which to compute the signatures, and whether the signatures should be reported at genome-wide level or by item (chromosomes, genes, etc.). For details on computational algorithmes for piRNA and siRNA signatures, see `Antoniewski (2014)`_.
.. _Brennecke et al, 2009: http://dx.doi.org/10.1126/science.1165171 .. _Antoniewski (2014): https://link.springer.com/protocol/10.1007%2F978-1-4939-0931-5_12
**Input**
A **sorted** BAM alignment file.
**Outputs**
**Global**: The number of pairs founds, the ping-pong signal and the associated z-scores are computed at genome-wide level and returned in a pdf file.
**Lattice**: The number of pairs founds, the ping-pong signals and the associated z-scores are computed for each items described in the BAM alignment input and returned in a pdf file as a lattice graph.
